706270f-a.folder: Pierrepont Street & Monroe Place, Brooklyn, NY

706269f-a.text:
(1)
113 Pierrepont Street, at the N.E. corner of Monroe Place, showing
the Unitarian Church of the Saviour.
February 23, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from another angle, showing what is probably the chapel of
the Church.
March 1, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

705746f-b.text:
(1)
38 Monroe Place, east side, near Pierrepont Street, showing the Augustus Storrs House, now ocoupied by the Mendelbaum flat.
1916.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, another angle.
1916.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The sawe, showing part of the adjoining building (No. 40).
1916.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(4)
The same, another view.
1916.
Euugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706268f-c.text:
(1)
99-111 Pierrepont Street, north side, just west of Monroe Place, showing the Reformed Church-on-the Heights, at 103.
February 23, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from another angle, as seen in 1927.
November 7, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, from another angle, showing also Monroe Place.
February 23, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
